interesting_fact: Japan is home to the world's oldest company, Kongō Gumi, which was founded in 578 AD.
The Eiffel Tower can be 15 cm taller during the summer due to the expansion of iron in the heat.
Australia is the only country that is also a continent.
Brazil is home to the Amazon Rainforest, the largest tropical rainforest in the world.
Canada has the longest coastline of any country in the world, stretching over 202,000 kilometers.
The Great Pyramid of Giza is the only remaining wonder of the ancient Seven Wonders of the World.
India is the birthplace of four major world religions: Hinduism, Buddhism, Jainism, and Sikhism.
Italy is home to the world's smallest country, Vatican City, which is an independent city-state surrounded by Rome.
Russia is the largest country in the world, spanning over 17 million square kilometers.
South Africa is the only country in the world to have hosted the soccer, cricket, and rugby world cups.
